The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. It is centered in the image. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] Step 2: Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. This will form the base of the prism. Step 3: Draw a rectangle with dimensions 0.1042 x 0.375 Draw a rectangle by placing four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1042, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1042, 0.0], End Point [0.1042, 0.0208] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1042, 0.0208], End Point [0.0, 0.0208] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0208], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This rectangle serves as the base of the prism. Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1042 (sketch_scale parameter). Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (-90 degrees along the Z-axis) and translation vector (0, 0.375, 0) defined in the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to create the 3D model of the prism: - Depth Towards Normal: 0.1875 - Depth Opposite Normal: 0.1875 The first part is now complete, with the rectangular prism having a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, and it is centered in the image. Move on to creating subsequent parts based on instructions provided in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
